Community graph partitioning algorithms

Source: R/member_community.R
community.Rd

Community graph partitioning algorithms

node_kernighanlin(object)

Arguments

object

An object of a migraph-consistent class:

  • matrix (adjacency or incidence) from {base} R

  • edgelist, a data frame from {base} R or tibble from {tibble}

  • igraph, from the {igraph} package

  • network, from the {network} package

  • tbl_graph, from the {tidygraph} package

Functions

  • node_kernighanlin: A greedy, iterative, deterministic graph partitioning algorithm that results in a graph with two equally-sized communities

References

Kernighan, Brian W., and Shen Lin. 1970. "An efficient heuristic procedure for partitioning graphs." The Bell System Technical Journal 49(2): 291-307. doi:10.1002/j.1538-7305.1970.tb01770.x

See also

Other membership: components(), equivalence

Examples

node_kernighanlin(ison_adolescents)
#> 1 
#>    Betty, Jane, Dale, Pam
#>  2 
#>    Sue, Alice, Carol, Tina
node_kernighanlin(ison_southern_women)
#> 1 
#>    E1, E2, E3, E4, E5, E6, E7, E8, E9, E10, E11, E12, E13, E14 
#>    OLIVIA, FLORA
#>  2 
#>     
#>    EVELYN, LAURA, THERESA, BRENDA, CHARLOTTE, FRANCES, ELEANOR, PEARL, RUTH, VERNE, MYRA, KATHERINE, SYLVIA, NORA, HELEN, DOROTHY
